document_title: Cosmetic (silicon) breast implant rupture: causes, signs and treatment
subsection_content:
Patients can recognize a ruptured breast implant by the following signs on the mammary gland, usually on one side:
Pain, tenderness or swelling; Change in size or shape.; Lumps in the breast; There are places where the breast is hard.
Breast implants can burst at any time. Breast implant rupture that does not cause any symptoms is called “silent rupture.” Silent breast implant rupture does not change the shape of the breast, so it is difficult to detect the crack. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is an effective method to detect this condition.
MRI scan helps identify breast implant rupture.
